business.headline: Sensex falls over 350 points, Nifty below 22,500; banking stocks downThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 379.73 points to close at 73,847.15, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 136.70 points to end at 22,399.15.
From Rajdhani to Vande Bharat: Investor criticises India's lag in train techWhen Rajdhani was launched in 1969, it placed India among Asia's fastest rail nations, second only to Japan.

RBI Governor says US tariff impact on growth bigger worry than inflationThe RBI's rate cut comes at a time when inflation appears to be under control, but economic growth faces risks from global uncertainty after US tariffs imposed by President Donald Trump.

RBI rate cut brings relief for borrowers, but banking stocks tumble. Here's whyBanking stocks, especially public sector lenders, took a sharp hit after the rate cut announcement. The Nifty Bank index was down nearly 1%, with major losers including Bank of Baroda, Canara Bank, Punjab National Bank, and SBI.

RBI monetary policy: 6 key takeaways from MPC meetingWith the repo rate cut, borrowing costs for home and personal loans are likely to fall. This would provide a big relief to the homebuyers and could boost the housing market.

RBI MPC meeting: 5 key development reforms you must knowCurrently, UPI payments are mostly capped at Rs 1 lakh for both P2P and P2M. The RBI has suggested that National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) may now review and revise these limits based on evolving user needs.

RBI cuts Repo Rate by 25 points to 6% amid global trade warThe Reserve Bank of India has cut the repo rate by 25 basis points to 6%, potentially leading to lower EMIs for home loans. The RBI has also lowered the GDP forecast for FY26 to 6.5% from the earlier 6.7%. The Monetary Policy Committee unanimously decided to change the stance from neutral to accommodative, hinting at possible further easing. The RBI Governor expressed concerns over global trade uncertainties and their potential impact on inflation and growth.

Cheaper home, auto loan EMIs after RBI rate cut. What it means for youRBI reduces key lending rate to 6%. Lower interest rates are expected to make borrowing cheaper, which can help people buy homes or vehicles more easily.

RBI changes stance from neutral to accommodative: What does it mean?The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Governor Sanjay Malhotra has announced a cut in the repo rate by 25 basis points, bringing it down from 6.25% to 6%.

RBI downgrades 2025-26 GDP forecast to 6.5% from 6.7% amid global tariff warWhile sharing the new projections, Governor Sanjay Malhotra said the downward revision of the GDP forecast was mainly due to growing risks in global trade and policy developments.

Donald Trump's 26% reciprocal tariffs on India come into effectA 26% tariff on Indian exports to the USA has come into effect. Key sectors impacted include electronics, gems and jewellery, auto components, and agricultural products. The Union Cabinet is set to meet to discuss India's strategy and the impact on exporters. The Indian government is in touch with exporters to minimise the impact, while also working on a bilateral trade agreement with the US.

Home loans to get cheaper as RBI cuts key lending rate by 25 basis points to 6%RBI MPC meeting: This is the second rate cut in a row, following a 25 basis point reduction in February. RBI also changed its earlier stance from neutral to 'accommodative'.

Trump's 26% tariffs on India come into effect, big Cabinet meet todayWith markets in a free fall since Donald Trump's reciprocal tariff announcement, the Union Cabinet will hold a crucial meeting today to strategise on ways to minimise the impact.
Sensex, Nifty open lower as RBI policy and global cues weigh on investorsThe S&P BSE Sensex fell by 255.49 points to 73,971.59, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 86.70 points to 22,449.15 as of 9:22 am.

RBI MPC: Will home loans get cheaper after today's policy announcement?RBI MPC meeting: In its last meeting held in February, the RBI cut the repo rate by 25 basis points. This was the first rate cut under RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra, and also the first cut in nearly five years.

Stock market today: Will RBI MPC decision pause Sensex, Nifty rally?The Sensex and Nifty ended Tuesday's session with big gains, but a global sell-off and worries about trade tensions are expected to affect today's opening.

Stocks to watch on April 9: NTPC, Adani Wilmar, Vodafone Idea, BPCLIn today's trade, many shares will be in focus due to key news developments. These include NTPC, BPCL, Adani Wilmar, Vodafone Idea, Cyient, PNB Housing Finance, and more.

S&P 500 hits lowest level in one year as hopes for Trump tariff relief fadeThe S&P 500 reached its lowest level in nearly a year after it reversed a strong morning rally, as hopes faded for any concessions or delays on President Donald Trump's global tariffs on US's trading partners set to come into effect on April 9.

US markets gain sharply on hopes of tariff talks: Will Dalal Street continue rally?If Wall Street wraps up today's session on a strong note, it could deliver a big dose of confidence to investors worldwide, especially in Asian markets.

US markets rally as Dow Jones jumps 1,100 points, Nasdaq, S&P surge 3%The surge in US stocks came as investors looked for any indication that the US might be open to easing some of its tougher tariffs through negotiations.

Opting for new tax regime? Know about this Rs 7,000 post office savings benefitAs per a government notification issued back in 2011, interest from post office savings accounts is exempt under Section 10(15) of the Income Tax Act.

Sensex, Nifty end higher on global recovery and RBI rate cut expectationsThe S&P BSE Sensex added 1,089.18 points to close at 74,227.08, while the NSE Nifty5o gained 374.25 points to end at 22,535.85.

RBI MPC to announce decision on April 9: Will there be a rate cut?Since the last MPC meeting, held in February 2025, a lot of things have changed, both positive and negative. While inflation has come down, and growth has started to pick up, there are fresh worries about the global economy.

'Economic nuclear war': Billionaire business titans slam Trump's tariff gambitDonald Trump's tariff agenda is fracturing elite support, with top businessmen — from Bill Ackman to Jamie Dimon — warning it risks recession, inflation, and global instability.

Hotmail co-founder Sabeer Bhatia on Indian engineers: '99% start giving gyaan'Sabeer Bhatia pointed out that in India, people respect those who talk business, not those who write code or build software. This mindset, he says, is stopping India from becoming a hub of innovation.

Sensex up 1,600 points: Which stocks are driving the rally on Dalal Street?Markets saw a huge rebound from yesterday's crash as they staged a robust recovery as no stocks on the Sensex of Nifty50 traded in red in the afternoon session.

Trump's tariff war may backfire, says JPMorgan CEO, urges stronger India tiesJPMorgan CEO, Jamie Dimon, explained that higher costs of imported goods would affect consumers, while increased demand for local products could also drive prices up.

Unified Pension Scheme: Centre studying global models to manage UPS pool corpusThe government aims to create proper rules for investing the extra contribution made by it in a separate pension fund called the pool corpus under the newly launched Unified Pension Scheme (UPS).

Japan's Nikkei leads Asia's recovery as hopes rise for softer tariff approachA 5.6% rebound in Japan's Nikkei far outpaced other regional markets, with Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and Trade Representative Jamieson Greer tasked with leading trade negotiations with Tokyo.

Explained: Why Titan share price jumped 7% after hitting 52-week lowThe recovery in Titan share price came just a day after the stock touched its 52-week low of Rs 2,947.55. In the morning session, Titan shares climbed to a high of Rs 3,222, providing some relief to investors after a tough few months.

Sensex, Nifty in green: Why is stock market rising today? 3 things to knowSensex, Nifty today: Tracking global markets that showed signs of recovery, Sensex and Nifty surged more than 1.5% in early trade, shaking off fears that had weighed heavily just a day earlier, with early buying seen across most sectors.
Sensex, Nifty gain as global markets recover from Trump's tariff shockThe S&P BSE Sensex surged 1,217.78 points to 74,355.68, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 380.50 points to 22,542.10 as of 9:35 am.
Global markets show signs of recovery. Will Sensex and Nifty gain today?A slight improvement in global markets, especially in the US and Asia, has brought some hope after the recent sell-off.

Stocks to watch on April 8: M&M, BEL, Adani Ports, Tata Motors, TitanInvestors are likely to keep a close eye on Tuesday's market, looking for signs of a rebound. Asian markets opened higher, offering some relief after a choppy session in the US.

Wall Street's fear gauge spikes, stocks sink as Trump stands firm on tariffsWall Street equities have been hammered since US President Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs, announced on April 2, on all imports into the US and much higher levies on some major trading partners.

How market reacted briefly to Donald Trump tariff pause rumourA misinterpreted comment about Trump pausing tariffs briefly sent markets soaring before crashing. Social media spread the false claim, prompting a quick White House denial that ended the short-lived rally.

Wall Street slides again on tariff fears; will Sensex, Nifty follow suit?Wall Street remained weak on Monday, with all three major indexes falling for a third straight session. The drop came after US President Donald Trump announced a new round of heavy tariffs on imports, which led to retaliation from major trade partners, including China.

S&P 500 rebounds after early trade fall in volatile US market sessionThe S&P 500 has dropped 20% from its peak closing level reached in February. If it finishes at this level or lower, it would officially mark the start of a bear market from February onward.

LPG cylinder prices hiked by Rs 50 for both subsidised, non-subsidised consumersThe government has hiked LPG prices to recover past losses, pushing up household cooking costs at a time of rising economic uncertainty and global trade tensions.

After Trump, EU wants India to remove tariffs on car imports: ReportThe European Union is pressing India to eliminate steep import tariffs on automobiles under a long-delayed trade deal , with India signalling a willingness to offer more attractive terms.

entertainment.headline: MM Keeravani 'privileged' to meet Father of MP3 Karlheinz BrandenburgOscar-winning music composer MM Keeravani recently met Karlheinz Brandenburg, the 'Father of MP3'. Sharing his heartfelt emotions about meeting the legend, he also posted a picture with him.
Manoj Manchu protests outside father Mohan Babu's home: Have no place to goActor Manchu Manoj staged a protest outside his father Mohan Babu's residence in Jalpally, citing that he has nowhere to go.

Mohan Babu, Vishnu Manchu meet Yogi Adityanath, share Kannappa's release dateThe Kannappa team, including Mohan Babu and Vishnu Manchu, visited Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath in Lucknow. They unveiled a poster and the new release date for their film.

30 years after fallout, Rajinikanth reveals why he spoke against JayalalithaaSuperstar Rajinikanth opened up about what influenced his stance against late Tamil Nadu chief minister Jayalalithaa. He described how his critical comment led to the sacking of a minister, which shaped his opposition.

It Ends With Us actor responds to Blake Lively's lawsuit: I was surprisedActor Adam Mondschein has publicly responded to Blake Lively's lawsuit allegations regarding an uncomfortable filming experience in It Ends With Us. Mondschein refuted Lively's claims, stating his perspective of the events.

The Last of Us: A primer to Pedro Pascal series that took TV by stormHBO's The Last of Us, which released in 2023, is a remarkable and unlikely dystopian show that graced modern television. It makes a return next week. Ahead of The Last of Us Season 2 premiere, here is a quick recap of events that unfolded in the first season.

How Empuraan's success, Sikandar's failure highlight Bollywood's content crisisMohanlal's 'Empuraan' and Salman Khan's 'Sikandar' clashed at the box office this March. The stark contrast in the films' results exposes serious issues in Bollywood at large.
Himesh Reshammiya announces Cap Mania Tour: Check dates, how to book tickets, moreSinger Himesh Reshammiya announced his Cap Mania Tour. The composer is set to perform in Mumbai and Delhi.

Jr NTR to join director Prashanth Neel for shoot from April end, makers confirmJr NTR to start shooting for Prashanth Neel's next project, tentatively titled NTRNeel, at the end of April. The production house, Mythri Movie Makers, made the announcement on their social media.

SRK, Kajol's Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge statue to be unveiled in LondonShah Rukh Khan and Kajol's Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge statue is set to be unveiled in London. The film will celebrate its 30th anniversary in October.

K-pop group Blackpink unveils 2025 world tour datesBlackpink announces their 2025 international tour with shows across Seoul, North America, Europe, and Asia. Fans can expect powerful performances from the group.

Tom Cruise set to return to Cannes with Mission Impossible The Final ReckoningTom Cruise is set to return to the Cannes Film Festival red carpet with 'Mission: Impossible – The Final Reckoning'. The film, directed by Christopher McQuarrie, will premiere on May 14, ahead of its Indian release.
Kangana Ranaut shocked by electricity bill of Rs 1 lakh for Manali homeActor-MP Kangana Ranaut recently expressed her shock upon receiving the electricity bill of Rs 1 lakh for her Manali residence.

Sikandar box office: Salman Khan's film earns the lowest on 2nd TuesdaySuperstar Salman Khan's film Sikandar is witnessing a sharp decline at the box office. On Day 10, the AR Murugadoss directorial recorded its lowest earnings since release.

Rishabh Sharma's Kal Ho Naa Ho's 'soulful' sitar rendition wins internetRishab Rikhiram Sharma's sitar rendition of Kal Ho Naa Ho captivated audiences in New Delhi, leaving many in awe of his soulful performance. The concert, part of his Sitar for Mental Health India tour, drew praise and admiration from fans both present and online.

Ajay Devgn, Vaani Kapoor react to replacing Ileana D'Cruz in Raid 2Actors Ajay Devgn and Vaani Kapoor recently reacted to questions about replacing Ileana D'Cruz in Raid 2. Ileana was the female lead of Raid.

Soha Ali Khan disappointed about BCCI retiring Pataudi CupThe Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) and the England and Wales Cricket Board's (ECB) decision to retire the Pataudi Trophy has sparked disappointment among the Pataudi family, as the trophy honours the legacy of Mansoor Ali Khan Pataudi, a pioneer in Indian cricket. Soha Ali Khan said in an interview that her father should be remembered in some form.

Jr NTR saddened as Pawan Kalyan's son gets injured in Singapore school fireJr NTR expressed his sorrow after Pawan Kalyan's youngest son, Mark Shankar, sustained injuries in a fire accident at his school in Singapore. Taking to X, he shared a note wishing him a speedy recovery.

Robert Pattinson in talks for Denis Villeneuve's star-studded Dune 3 cast: ReportDenis Villeneuve is considering Robert Pattinson for a role in the upcoming Dune: Messiah film. The potential casting adds to the star-studded lineup including Timothee Chalamet and Zendaya.

general news.headline: China announces 84% tariffs on US in big trade war escalationChina announced tariffs of up to 84 per cent on US goods in response to the Donald Trump administration's 104 per cent duties on Chinese imports, escalating the intensifying US-China trade war.

The vanishing daughters: 10 years of Beti Bachao Beti PadhaoFor ten years, a campaign to save the girl child has occupied walls, been heard in slogans, and spoken as a promise. But behind the posters and promises lies a brutal truth—girls are still being erased before they are born, and those who survive often live in fear.

India stops trans-shipment for Bangladesh after Yunus calls Northeast 'landlocked'India has revoked a key transit facility for Bangladeshi exports via its territory, days after Dhaka's interim leader Muhammad Yunus pitched for China's economic entry into India's Northeast.

US even cancelling visas of Indian students found not guilty by courtsIndian students in the US, who spend lakhs to study in American universities, are increasingly facing visa cancellations over minor offences. What's most alarming is that even those found not guilty by courts have been asked to self-deport, an immigration lawyer fighting such cases in the US told India Today Digital.

Pamban Bridge revives age-old dream, a direct train from Chennai to ColomboAn India-Sri Lanka direct rail or road link needs just a 25-km-long bridge. The Pamban Bridge, recently inaugurated by PM Narendra Modi, completes a crucial part of a direct train from Chennai to Colombo. Planned by the British, and brought to the drawing table time and again, an India-Lanka rail link would boost both ties and trade.

30 years after fallout, Rajinikanth reveals why he spoke against JayalalithaaSuperstar Rajinikanth opened up about what influenced his stance against late Tamil Nadu chief minister Jayalalithaa. He described how his critical comment led to the sacking of a minister, which shaped his opposition.

Tahawwur Rana, David Headley spoke 231 times during recces before 26/11: NIAPakistani-American terrorist David Coleman Headley was in touch with 2008 Mumbai terror attacks plotter Tahawwur Hussain Rana and called him more than 32 times when he first visited India to conduct recces on September 14, 2006, according to the NIA dossier exclusively accessed by India Today TV.

Why Beijing isn't blinking in trade war against TrumpIn retaliation for Trump's additional 50 per cent tariff on China, which pushed the total to a staggering 104 per cent, Beijing has announced tariffs of up to 84 per cent on US goods, effective Thursday.

How Empuraan's success, Sikandar's failure highlight Bollywood's content crisisMohanlal's 'Empuraan' and Salman Khan's 'Sikandar' clashed at the box office this March. The stark contrast in the films' results exposes serious issues in Bollywood at large.

Cops raid rented house in Karnataka, find Rs 500 'Reverse Bank of India' notesThe police raided a rented house in Dandeli, Uttara Kannada, uncovering suspicious currency. The currency was a stash of Rs 500 notes marked 'for movie shooting'.

Trump says countries kissing my a**, mocks world leaders negotiating US tariffsDonald Trump's remarks come as US tariffs officially kicked in, prompting swift international responses and intensifying debate over his unilateral approach.

Air India passenger urinates on another on Delhi-Bangkok flightThe incident happened in the business class of Air India flight AI 2336, when a man urinated on a fellow-passenger, who is said to be the Managing Director of a big company.

The making of Priyansh Arya: No phones, gurukul-like training in jungleYoungster Priyansh Arya scored a stunning century in the IPL vs CSK. IndiaToday caught up with Priyansh coach Sanjay Bhardwaj, who provided some stunning details behind his preparation.
BJP leaked videos of Trinamool's infighting. They came out and fought in openBJP lit a match, Trinamool's senior leaders fanned the flames and Mamata urged them to 'calm down'—to no avail.

India clears Rs 63,000-crore deal to buy 26 Rafale Navy jets from France: SourcesWith the Rs 63,000-crore Rafale Marine deal cleared, India moves to phase out MiG-29Ks by 2031, positioning INS Vikrant and INS Vikramaditya for advanced carrier-based combat operations.

Mobs plunder KFC, Bata outlets in Bangladesh. Why Dhaka is on boil againBangladesh protests: Outlets of international brands such as Bata, KFC, Pizza Hut, and Puma were vandalised and looted in Bangladesh as thousands took to the streets to protest against Israel.

Namita Thapar reacts to Hotmail co-founder's 'Indian engineers giving gyaan' remarkSabeer Bhatia said earlier this week that "99% of Indians who graduate as engineers join management and start giving gyaan to everybody."

Eat, pray, wrestle, repeat: A look inside UK's viral wrestling churchA UK church is going viral for mixing pro wrestling with prayer, drawing crowds with body slams, baptisms, and sermons in a ring under stained-glass windows.

Gunfight between security forces, terrorists underway in J&K's Kishtwar, UdhampurAn encounter between security forces and terrorists broke out in Udhampur on Wednesday. Soon after, another gunfight erupted in Udhampur. Two to three terrorists are believed to be trapped at each location.

Champions League: Top 5 comebacks that left football world stunnedFrom Barcelona's legendary "La Remontada" to Liverpool's Anfield masterclass, the Champions League has been home to some of the greatest comebacks in football history. Here's a look at five unforgettable matches that defined the spirit of European football.

The Last of Us: A primer to Pedro Pascal series that took TV by stormHBO's The Last of Us, which released in 2023, is a remarkable and unlikely dystopian show that graced modern television. It makes a return next week. Ahead of The Last of Us Season 2 premiere, here is a quick recap of events that unfolded in the first season.

How the human body copes with sizzling temperaturesThe human body relies on an internal thermostat, primarily governed by the hypothalamus, to maintain a stable temperature around 37 degrees Celsius. But this balance is challenged in hot and humid weather.

2 women assaulted for saying 'excuse me' amid Marathi vs non-Marathi tensionThe women were on a two-wheeler when they approached the entrance of their housing society and asked a man who was blocking the entrance to move aside by saying "excuse me".
Sensex falls over 350 points, Nifty below 22,500; banking stocks downThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 379.73 points to close at 73,847.15, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 136.70 points to end at 22,399.15.

sports.headline: DC captain Axar Patel doesn't want to be only voice in team: Assistant coach MottDC assistant coach Matthew Mott heaped praise on captain Axar Patel, claiming that he doesn't want to be the only voice in the team. Axar has enjoyed a fine start to life as DC skipper in IPL 2025.

Street cricket to IPL: Abhishek Dalhor roped in as KKR net bowler for ongoing seasonIndian Street Premier League star Abhishek Dalhor has been roped in by Kolkata Knight Riders to be one of their net bowlers for the ongoing season of the IPL. Dalhor has been a star performer in ISPL.

People will choose to watch PSL over IPL if we perform well: Hasan AliPakistan fast bowler Hasan Ali has made a bold statement that if they perform well in the upcoming Pakistan Super League (PSL) viewers will choose to watch them over IPL.

Attitude, backing your game: Ponting's highlights of Priyansh's 103 vs CSKRicky Ponting revealed his highlights from Priyansh Arya's fantastic hundred against Chennai Super Kings on Tuesday, April 8. Priyansh scored 103 off 42 balls in Mullanpur to help PBKS secure their third win of the season.

NBA: They paid for tickets, but I had enough, Luka Doncic after getting ejectedLos Angeles Lakers guard Luka Doncic was ejected in the fourth quarter of Tuesday night's game against the Oklahoma City Thunder following his second technical foul.

NBA: Say hello to the greatest shooter, Steve Kerr reminds Hield of Stephen Curry's greatnessSteve Kerr is leading the charge, and the Golden State Warriors continue their strong push toward the NBA playoffs. The team has surged since acquiring All-Star guard Jimmy Butler in early February, owning the NBA's third-best record at 22-6 during that stretch.

NBA: Selena Gomez and Benny Blanco steal the spotlight courtside at Knicks-Celtics gameAward-winning singer and actress Selena Gomez attended the New York Knicks-Boston Celtics game alongside her fiancé, acclaimed music producer Benny Blanco.

How Premier League can have 7 teams in Champions League from 2025-2026Premier League teams are set to benefit from UEFA's new format, with five clubs earning direct Champions League qualification from next season. Thanks to strong European performances, up to seven English clubs could play in the 2025–26 Champions League.

Virat Kohli: I never tried to overshadow anyoneRoyal Challengers Bengaluru talisman Virat Kohli has said that he has never tried to overshadow anyone in the cricketing ecosystem. Kohli has been in strong form in IPL 2025 so far.

The team has surged since acquiring All-Star guard Jimmy Butler in early February, owning the NBA's third-best record at 22-6 during that stretch.

Thanks to strong European performances, up to seven English clubs could play in the 2025–26 Champions League.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
